info.title: Assigning a PCI device to a virtual machine using &vmm;

abstract.para: Assigning a &vmhost;'s PCI device to a &vmguest;—also known as &pciback;—dedicates the PCI device's resources to the &vmguest;. After the PCI device is assigned, it cannot be used by the &vmhost; or by any other &vmguest; on the same &vmhost;. The following procedure describes how to assign a &vmhost;'s PCI device to a &vmguest; using the &vmm; GUI application.

step.para: Double-click a &vmguest; entry in the &vmm; to open its console, then switch to the Details view with View Details .
Click Add Hardware and choose the PCI Host Device category in the left panel. A list of available PCI devices appears in the right part of the window.
From the list of available PCI devices, choose the one you want to pass to the guest. Confirm with Finish.
